attributes.action: Cancel HS2 & divert funds to Social Care and NHS for assistance with COVID-19.
attributes.additional_details:
Experts are warning of an extended period of COVID-19 cases being in circulation and to last until 2021. 

At this time, a highspeed rail line doesn't need to be developed when possible fatalities are expected to rise considerably. With many front line staff in the NHS, social care and even the services expected to assist people in the next year, the availability of all funding should come from HS2 as there is no immediate benefit and can be picked back up on after the crisis has passed.
attributes.background:
In the growing crisis of the COVID-19 Pandemic, we wish for the government to prioritise and half HS2 until the crisis has passed.

Social Care for Over 70s in particular and NHS front line services will require as much money beyond the budget announced by Rishi Sunak in early March 2020.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302756

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
